titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Elisavietta Ritchie literary papers, 1947-2014 MS2333
titlestmt.author: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

publicationstmt.publisher: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-01-11 11:44:08 -0500.

repository.corpname: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

did.abstract: Elisavietta (Lisa) Ritchie's fiction, poetry, creative non-fiction, photographs, and translations from Russian and French have appeared in numerous publications. This collection includes various drafts and publications of poems and stories written by Ritchie. It also contains correspondence to and from Ritchie, including letters from her parents and correspondence written in Russian. The collection dates from 1964-2014.
did.physloc: Materials are stored off-site, and will require additional retrieval time. Please contact the Special Collections Research Center for more information.

scopecontent.head: Collection Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains literary papers related to the life and career of writer Elisavietta Ritchie. This includes various drafts and publications of poems and stories, as well as a few items of publicity. It also includes correspondence with her parents, George L. Artamoff and Jessie B. Downing, and letters in Russian. The collection dates from 1964-2014.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Some material may be copyrighted or restricted. It is the patron's obligation to determine and satisfy copyright or other case restrictions when publishing or otherwise distributing materials found in the collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please cite unpublished materials in the following way:
Please provide the title and date of item, catalog number (if applicable it will be found written on the folder), name of the collection, name of the repository, and location of the repository.

Example: James Oglethorpe to the Trustees, 13 January 1876, RG0001 Series 1, Box 4, Folder 3. Records of the Board of Trustees, Special Collections Research Center, Gelman Library, The George Washington University, Washington, D.C.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Elisavietta (Lisa) Richie's fiction, poetry, creative non-fiction, photographs, and translations from Russian and French have appeared in numerous publications and have won various awards. Ritchie has read at the Library of Congress, Harbourfront, Folger Library, Pittsburgh International Forum, many libraries, universities, schools and other cultural centers in the United States, Canada, Australia, Russia, and under the auspices of the United States Information Agency, in Brazil, around the Far East, and the Balkans. She often teaches writing workshops for adults and children, and occasionally lectures to teachers on the poetry-in-the-school program.

She founded The Wineberry Press, and for three years was president of Washington Writer's Publishing House. Books edited include The Dolphin's Arc: Poems on Endangered Creatures of the Sea. Her photographs have appeared in The New York Times etc.

arrangement.head: Collection Organization
arrangement.p: Organized into 3 series: Literary writings, Correspondence and Publications.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Elisavietta Ritchie, 19 October 2014 [2014.037]. A second smaller donation was made in 2017 (Accession 2017.043)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes various drafts and publications of poems and stories written by Elisavietta Ritchie. It also contains a few items of publicity material. It dates from 1964-2014.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes correspondence both to and from Elisavietta Ritchie. It contains a number of letters from her parents George L. Artamoff and Jessie B. Downing, as well as letters in Russian. It dates from 1964-2013.

Correspondence from Parents - George L. Artamoff and Jessie B. Downing (2/2)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains publications collected by Elisavietta Ritchie between 1947-2007.
